entry.title: New release for bknd: v0.10.0
entry.content:
React 19, Vite 6, Tailwind 4, etc. (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/108)

Many dependencies have been upgraded to the latest version, including React 19. If you're using React 19, the errors when resolving peer dependencies are gone.

Postgres Support (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/105)

It's nice to say bknd theoretically supports any SQL database until you prove it: You can now use bknd with Postgres! It uses pg under the hood, but it could be expanded to different flavors such as postgres to also support Postgres using Cloudflare Workers. To use Postgres, you have to install a separate package:

sh npm install @bknd/postgres

And then use it where you construct/serve your application (docs). Here is an example for Node.js: ```js import { serve } from "bknd/adapter/node"; import { PostgresConnection } from "@bknd/postgres";

serve({ connection: new PostgresConnection({ connectionString: "postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/database", }), }); ```

Other changes

  • remove admin config, improve theme handling by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/103
  • fix/nextjs-linting-and-adapter by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/110
  • added basic cli telemetry by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/111
  • replaced remix with react-router by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/112
  • add sqlocal connection including example by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/113
  • admin ui: started color centralization + made sidebar resizable by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/114
  • fix s3 media upload in node environments by adding content length to request by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/116

Full Changelog: https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/compare/v0.9.1...v0.10.0

entry.title: New release for bknd: v0.11.0
entry.content:
Media: Infinite loading & Detail Dialog (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/123)

The media screen is now infinitely loading more media entries as you scroll. When you click on an item, a detail dialog tries to preview the file and shows related information including quick-copy snippets.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7c19321a-1fca-4b1e-bf0e-108e828f8ac1

Adapter & Starters improvements + E2E

There's been a ton of fixes and adjustments for the adapter implementation and cli starters. The cloudflare (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/119, https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/120) and AWS (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/134) starter are now running smoother generating required infrastructure parts. Adapters have been aligned more tightly so that they can now run a shared unit and e2e test suite to ensure they work as expected (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/124, https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/126, https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/135).

CLI: Better env discovery (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/125) & user token generation (https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/140)

The CLI now detects the desired environment smarter (e.g. if you use npx bknd run by checking the given parameters, then checks existence of a bknd.config.* file, afterwards reads environment variables (DB_URL, DB_TOKEN) and only then falls back to generate a new file as database. This now enables creating a dedicated bknd.config.ts file that contains all instructions how to start your instance, in your app but also using the CLI. If you choose to exclude the Admin UI from your app, you can now still run it locally using the CLI (npx bknd run). Here is an example bknd.config.ts:

``ts // import the config of your adapter which inherits fromBkndConfig` import type { BkndConfig } from "bknd/adapter";

export default { // you can also pass a postgres connection connection: { url: "file:data.db", }, // an initial config is only applied if the database was empty initialConfig: { / ... / }, options: { // the seed function is only executed if the database was empty seed: async (ctx) => { await ctx.em.mutator("").insertMany([ / ... / ]); await ctx.app.module.auth.createUser({ / ... / }); }, }, } as const satisfies BkndConfig; ```

Additionally, you can now generate tokens of users for authentication. It uses the same discovery as run to determine which environment to generate tokens from. To start the interaction, run:

sh npx bknd user token

Other Changes

  • Fix Astro create CLI by @cameronapak in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/128
  • refactored EventManager to run asyncs on call only, app defaults to run before response by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/129
  • keep extension from file when generating random name by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/127
  • fixed limbo batching issue by disabling batching by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/133
  • docker: add option to overwrite bknd version used by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/136
  • cli: create: allow non-interactive create by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/137
  • fixes issues in firefox where view transitions are not available by @dswbx in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/139

New Contributors

  • @cameronapak made their first contribution in https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/pull/128

Full Changelog: https://github.com/bknd-io/bknd/compare/v0.10.1...v0.11.0
